page.title: 15CONSERVATION in EDINBURGH
page.content:
Originally the Grange area was a large country estate. Most of the houses were large villas. A lot of these have been split into flats, converted into schools, small hospitals, nursing homes or hotels, or demolished. Oswald house was demolished in the late sixties and Oswald Court now stands on the site - a complex of modern flats.Of 17 Victorian houses, 7 were divided to flats.13 of these large houses had had maids rooms.Cleaners were employed twice a week in 6 of the houses.
Grange Association was formed in 1980 to protect trees and buildings in the area and is well supported locally. Trees cannot be cut down, buildings altered or new houses built without strict rules being adhered to.
